Set Workspace

Use the Set Workspace dialog box (File | Set Workspace) to set your workspace. You can also create, rename, or delete a workspace from this dialog box.

Note: Renaming your default workspace automatically resets the root workspace as your default.

Field Descriptions

List Select the workspace to associate with the current project database. A blue diamond identifies the workspace that is currently set.
Owner If the Root Workspace is selected in the Workspaces list, this read-only field displays the project database name. If a workspace is selected, the type of workspace is displayed: public, which affects the workfile location of everyone using it, or private, which only affects the workfile location of the user who created and set it.
Make this your default workspace Select to associate this workspace with the project database for subsequent Version Manager sessions; otherwise, this workspace will only be active during the current Version Manager session.
New button Click to display the New Workspace dialog box for creating a new workspace. The new workspace will take its initial settings from the workspace selected in the Workspace list. (However, public workspaces cannot inherit from private workspaces.)
Rename button Click to display the Rename dialog box for entering a new name for the selected workspace. You cannot rename the Root Workspace.
Delete button Click to delete the selected workspace. You cannot delete the Root Workspace.
